authors: Tom Flanagan For Daily Mail Australia
description: A 71 year old man has been stabbed in the head with a pitchfork by three intruders in his South Melbourne home. The men left with nothing following the pensioners heroic resistance.
title: Melbourne man attacked by pitchfork in his own home
title_page: Melbourne man attacked by pitchfork in his own home | Daily Mail Online
text:
An elderly man has been stabbed in the head with a pitchfork as he fought off three armed intruders in his Cranbourne North home.
It is understood that three men entered Rick Maaskant's home in South Melbourne around 11.20pm on Wednesday evening before he confronted the intruders.
He was then stabbed above his left eye with what is thought to be a pitchfork as the men fled the property, according to 9 News.
Grandfather Rick Maaskant was attacked with a pitchfork by three men who invaded his home
Mr Maaskant's home where three armed men entered around 11.20pm
Police at the scene of the crime where three men fled the home of pensioner of Rick Maaskant, after attacking him with a pitchfork
The intruders, who are thought to have left with nothing, are described by police as caucasian, in their early twenties, and wearing dark-coloured clothing.
Neighbour Mary Arul Ganesh said she heard the men outside the property before they entered Mr Maaskant's home.
'We were watching people walking around on our [CCTV] camera, it's really scary' she said.
This latest incident has contributed to a growing number of crimes in Victoria, which has increased by more than 10% compared to last years figures according to the Crime Statistics Agency.
Mr Maarskant was taken to hospital with his injuries not deemed as life threatening.
Anyone with any information on the three men is urged to call Crimestoppers 1800 333 000.
